moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: A standard position in the ...Kc7 line.
moves.11. Na3 a6 12. Nc4+ Ka7 13. Nc7: White wins the exchange and approached material equality, but Black is willing to give up material to defuse the attack.
moves.17. d3 exd3 18. Nxd3 Nc6 19. Be3 c4: Black wants to keep the Queen in the center.
moves.22. Bxc5 Qxc5+ 23. Kh1 Nd4 24. c3 Nxf3 2: At this point, Black has eliminated the two bishops, and has an active Q, which should give Black the advantage.
moves.25... Rf8 26. Ne5 Qc7 27. Rad1 g5 28. g3: Having opened up the position, Black wants to exploit the mobility of the Q.
moves.30. Nxc4 Qxa2 31. Nb6+ Ka7 32. Nd7 Rd8: Black has acccomplished his strategic goals. White can't really afford to exchange the rooks.
moves.33. Rd2 Qa4 34. Rfd1 Qxf4: Having forced the win of the weak pawn and accomplished his strategic goal, Black's Q is now active and White's position is very difficult. White resigns.
